oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Itinerary for Gold Star Widows and Mothers Pilgrimage
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Ring family of Franklin, Tenn., provided three of their four sons to the Army in WWI. The third oldest, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div., was killed in Oct., 1918. In the early 1930s the US government offered trips to Gold Star Widows and Mothers to visit the graves of their loved ones. Sarah Frances M. Ring and her daughter, Emma Mai, made the voyage in 1933. This typed document lists the daily itineraries, a roster of those on the trip, maps, and information for sightseeing.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
